Detailed Description

The class GenericAudioDevice is the base class for audio device classes and describes the general interface.

Note: Do not use audio interface given by the *AudioDevices* header files as they are outdated and will be removed.

GenericAudioDevice::AudioReturnCode GenericAudioDevice::Init (  Priority  prio = PrioNormal  )  [virtual]
 

Allocates HW

Parameters:
prio Priority for HW allocation. Note: As the HW is limited only leave AudioDevice instance idealized state when used when audio is going to be used. Otherwise the AudioDevice instance may block other instances from accessing the audio HW.

GenericAudioDevice::AudioReturnCode GenericAudioDevice::Start (  BOOLEAN  auto_release = TRUE  )  [virtual]
 

Plays the requested tone.
A message is send when the tone stops playing. The volume level will be last one selected AudioSetVolume method. If a tone is started before the present one is finished, the present tone will be disabled and the new tone is started, i.e. no suspend/resume functionality.
Note: Release the HW by using Release() to enable other instances of to access the HW.

Parameters:
auto_release,: If TRUE Release is called after the tone stops playing.
Returns:
Result of operation.

Reimplemented in AmplifierAudioDevice, KeyToneAudioDevice, Mp3AudioDevice, RingerAudioDevice, SpeechAudioDevice, ToneAudioDevice, and VoiceMemoAudioDevice.

GenericAudioDevice::AudioReturnCode GenericAudioDevice::Stop (  UINT8  channel = 0  )  [virtual]
 

Stops the audio device.

Parameters:
channel Channel to stop. Channel applies only if to SMAF-phrase format tones are played (audio device ringer).

Reimplemented in AmplifierAudioDevice, KeyToneAudioDevice, Mp3AudioDevice, RingerAudioDevice, SpeechAudioDevice, ToneAudioDevice, and VoiceMemoAudioDevice.
